attributes.action: Ensure fraud by MPs is punished along similar lines to benefit fraud
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This is just another example of one set of laws for the MPs and another for us....

Mr Derek Conway MP has been reprimanded for overpaying his younger son from parliamentary money and could face more scrutiny over his elder son. 

He now faces a PATHETIC penalty of 10 days suspension from the House of Commons. 

The Commons Standards and Privileges Committee, which found that he overpaid his younger son Freddie, said he should be forced to pay back up to £13,161 of his son's salary. WHAT ABOUT A CRIMINAL RECORD?

Mr Conway apologised unreservedly to MPs for Freddie's pay and said he had let down his family "very badly indeed". OH WELL THEN, I THINK WE SHOULD LET HIM OFF.

WHY IS THIS MP NOT BEING PROSECUTED?
We chase benefit fraud; so why not MPs?
